result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Prior: W10538 VALLEY VIEW RD, SHAWANO, WI 54166
Final pre-trial on September 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

4:14 PM  Defendant BRADLEY J. MILLER in court, in custody.  Attorney Laura Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bradley J Jansen in court for BRADLEY J. MILLER. 
Atty Jansen - DE to waive prelim.  Court reviews prelim rights w/DE.  DE waives prelim.  Court accepts waiver, finds probable cause and binds the matter over for trial. 
ADA Nelson - information to mirror complaint and be filed within 10 days. 

ARRAIGNMENT:
Atty Jansen - waives reading, enters NG pleas, requests cases to be heard w/ Br. 1 cases.  Court agrees with request for judicial economy.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Joseph J. Kaupie in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant BRADLEY J. MILLER appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Bradley J Jansen in court for BRADLEY J. MILLER. Defense requests a preliminary hearing.  Bond remains in effect.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 3, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
filed by defendant - sent to Branch 2

8:51 AM. Defendant BRADLEY J. MILLER in court, in custody.  Attorney Laura Nelson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with per ADA Nelson. Court gives right to counsel to Defendant. Court gives the Defendant two options for today 1) waive right to atty. for this PH and proceed today pro se or 2) Waive time limits for holding the PH and wait for counsel to be appointed. Def. picks option 1. Court explains the benefits of having an atty. in these matters. Defendant addresses the Court - picks option 2 and requests Atty. Jansen be appointed onto this case as well. Court explains he needs to apply for PD services in this case. Court accepts the Defendants option, waives the time limits of the PH and will set a STC for an atty. update.
Status conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
